creditline: Gift of John B. Elliott, Class of 1951, to honor Gillett G. Griffin

texts.textentryhtml:
By 1959, Jay C. Leff (1925-2000), Uniontown, PA (no. 410) [1]. By January 8, 1968, John B. Elliott (1928-1997), Class of 1951, Princeton, NJ [2]; 1990, gift of John B. Elliot to the Princeton University Art Museum.

Notes:
[1] According to Exotic Art from Ancient and Primitive Civilizations: Collection of Jay C. Leff (Pittsburg, PA: Carnegie Institute, 1959), cat. no. 410.
[2] On loan to the museum in 1968 (L217.68)

bibliography.boilertext: Stephan F. de Borhegyi, "Ball-game Handstones and Ball-game Gloves," in Essays in Pre-Columbian Art and Archaeology (Cambridge: Harvard University Press, 1961): 126-151.
bibliography.citation: Stephan F. de Borhegyi, "Ball-game Handstones and Ball-game Gloves," in Essays in Pre-Columbian Art and Archaeology (Cambridge: Harvard University Press, 1961): 126-151., fig. 8.2–3 (illus.)

bibliography.citation: Exotic Art from Ancient and Primitive Civilizations: Collection of Jay C. Leff (Pittsburgh, Carnegie Institute of Pittsburgh, Department of Fine Arts, 1959)., cat. no. 410

caption: Zapotec, Late Classic Period (Peche or Xoo phase), 500–800 CE, Oaxaca, Central Valley of Oaxaca, Mexico, Mesoamerica, Manopla (handstone). Stone; 12.5 x 14.9 cm. Gift of John B. Elliott, Class of 1951, to honor Gillett G. Griffin (y1990-17)
